{{Infobox command
|name=clone
|oplevel=
* 2 {{only|java|short=1}}
* 1 {{only|bedrock|short=1}}
|others=[[Cheat]] only{{only|bedrock|short=1}}
}}

Clones [[block]]s from one region to another.

== Syntax ==

* '''Java Edition'''
: <code>clone . . .</code>
: <code>clone from <sourceDimension> . . .</code>
:* <code>... <begin> <end> . . .</code>
:** <code>... <destination> . . .</code>
:** <code>... to <targetDimension> <destination> . . .</code>
:*** <code>... [strict] [replace] [force|move|normal]</code>
:***: Clones all blocks.
:*** <code>... [strict] masked [force|move|normal]</code>
:***: Clones non-[[air]] blocks.
:*** <code>... [strict] filtered <filter> [force|move|normal]</code>
:***: Clones only blocks with the block id specified by <code><filter></code>.

* '''Bedrock Edition'''
: <code>clone <begin: x y z> <end: x y z> <destination: x y z> [maskMode: MaskMode] [cloneMode: CloneMode]</code>
:: Clones all blocks or only non-air blocks.
: <code>clone <begin: x y z> <end: x y z> <destination: x y z> filtered <cloneMode: CloneMode> <tileName: Block> [blockStates: block states]</code>
:: Clones only blocks with the block id specified by <code><tileName: Block></code>.

== Arguments ==

{{el|je|short=1}}: {{argument|sourceDimension|dimension}}
: Specifies the dimension to clone the blocks from. If unspecified, defaults to current execution dimension.
: {{arg desc|je=dimension}}

{{el|je|short=1}}: {{argument|begin|block_pos}} and {{argument|end|block_pos}}<br>
{{el|be|short=1}}: {{argument|be=1|begin: x y z|CommandPosition}} and {{argument|be=1|end: x y z|CommandPosition}}
: Specifies the coordinates of two opposing corner blocks of the source region.
: {{arg desc|je=block_pos|be=CommandPosition}}
: Block position is the coordinates of the point at the lower northwest corner of a block. Because of this, the lesser coordinates of each axis falls right on the region boundary, but the greater coordinates are one block from the boundary, and the block volume of the source region is (x<sub>greater</sub> - x<sub>lesser</sub> + 1) × (y<sub>greater</sub> - y<sub>lesser</sub> + 1) × (z<sub>greater</sub> - z<sub>lesser</sub> + 1). For example, <code>0 0 0 0 0 0</code> has a 1-block volume, and <code>0 0 0 1 1 1</code> and <code>1 1 1 0 0 0</code> both identify the same region with an 8-block volume.

{{el|je|short=1}}: {{argument|targetDimension|dimension}}
: Specifies the dimension to clone the blocks to. If unspecified, defaults to current execution dimension.
: {{arg desc|je=dimension}}

{{argument|destination|block_pos|destination: x y z|CommandPosition}}
: Specifies the lower northwest corner of the destination region.
: {{arg desc|je=block_pos|be=CommandPosition}}

{{el|je|short=1}}: {{code|replace}} and {{code|masked}}<br>
{{el|be|short=1}}: {{argument|be=1|maskMode: MaskMode|enum}}
: Specifies whether to filter the blocks being cloned. Must be one of the following:
:* <code>replace</code> — Copy all blocks, overwriting ''all'' blocks of the destination region with the blocks from the source region.
:* <code>masked</code> — Copy only non-air blocks. Blocks in the destination region that would otherwise be overwritten by air are left unmodified.
: If unspecified, defaults to <code>replace</code>.

{{el|je|short=1}}：{{cd|strict}}
: Makes the command place blocks as-is without triggering block updates and shape updates.

{{el|je|short=1}}: {{code|force{{!}}move{{!}}normal}}<br>
{{el|be|short=1}}: {{argument|be=1|cloneMode: CloneMode|enum}}
: Specifies how to treat the source region. Must be one of the following:
:* <code>force</code> — Force the clone even if the source and destination regions overlap.
:* <code>move</code> — Clone the source region to the destination region, then replace the source region with air. When used in filtered mask mode, only the cloned blocks are replaced with air.
:* <code>normal</code> — Don't move or force.
: If unspecified, defaults to <code>normal</code>.

{{argument|filter|block_predicate|tileName: Block|enum}}
: Specifies the block id to copy in <code>filtered</code> mode.
: {{arg desc|je=block_predicate|be=Block}}

{{el|be|short=1}}: {{argument|be=1|blockStates: block states|BlockStateCommandParam}}
: Specifies the [[block states]] to use for the block.
: {{Arg desc|be=BlockStateCommandParam}}
